pullRequest.body:
From LeanAPAP


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [5d037b835a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17024/commits/5d037b835ab31b0e83762be7e954b7a780e0e541)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Floor | 572 | 576 | +4 (+0.70%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>6 files</summary> `Mathlib.Algebra.ContinuedFractions.Computation.Translations` `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Floor` `Mathlib.Algebra.ContinuedFractions.Computation.Basic` `Mathlib.Data.Int.Log` `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Floor.Prime` `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Nonneg.Floor`</details>|4|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ GCongr.intCast_mono`
`+ ceil_div_ceil_inv_sub_one`
`+ ceil_lt_iff`
`+ le_ceil_iff`
`+ ⟨_,`
`++ ceil_le_mul`
`++ ceil_le_two_mul`
`++ ceil_lt_mul`
`++ ceil_lt_two_mul`
`++ div_two_lt_floor`
`++ mul_lt_floor`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10994158035/job/30522169951)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10994158035/job/30522169654)

Do we already have the floor versions, and sufficiently large versions of these? If not, let's mark them as TODO.

bors d+

Do we already have the floor versions, and sufficiently large versions of these? If not, let's mark them as TODO.

bors d+
We should have `le` versions of these too
What would the `le` version be? I'm pretty sure it would have exactly the same assumptions
I needed something stronger at some point but I can't find it right now - let's leave it for now
`⌈a⌉₊ <= 2 * a` for `0.5 <= a` is something I've needed a few times. Can leave it as TODO for now
GCongr.Int.cast_mono looks a bit more consistent with the others here
I think this is dangerous because `open Int GCongr` would result in `cast_mono` being ambiguous between `Int.cast_mono` and `Int.GCongr.Int.cast_mono`
positivity can't use ceil_pos?
It can, but only after the end of the file, which is where the positivity extension is provided
Let's either squeeze this or use a more flexible tactic afterwards

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `⌈a⌉ < 2 * a`
